source/include/boost/config/stdlib/roguewave.hpp

00001 //  (C) Copyright John Maddock 2001 - 2003. 
00002 //  (C) Copyright Jens Maurer 2001. 
00003 //  (C) Copyright David Abrahams 2003.

00005 //  Boost Software License, Version 1.0. (See accompanying file

00007 
00008 //  See http://www.boost.org for most recent version.
00009 
00010 //  Rogue Wave std lib:
00011 
00012 #if !defined(__STD_RWCOMPILER_H__) && !defined(_RWSTD_VER)
00013 #  include <utility>
00014 #  if !defined(__STD_RWCOMPILER_H__) && !defined(_RWSTD_VER)
00015 #     error This is not the Rogue Wave standard library
00016 #  endif
00017 #endif
00018 //
00019 // figure out a consistent version number:
00020 //
00021 #ifndef _RWSTD_VER
00022 #  define BOOST_RWSTD_VER 0x010000
00023 #elif _RWSTD_VER < 0x010000
00024 #  define BOOST_RWSTD_VER (_RWSTD_VER << 8)
00025 #else
00026 #  define BOOST_RWSTD_VER _RWSTD_VER
00027 #endif
00028 
00029 #ifndef _RWSTD_VER
00030 #  define BOOST_STDLIB "Rogue Wave standard library version (Unknown version)"
00031 #else
00032 #  define BOOST_STDLIB "Rogue Wave standard library version " BOOST_STRINGIZE(_RWSTD_VER)
00033 #endif
00034 
00035 //
00036 // Prior to version 2.2.0 the primary template for std::numeric_limits
00037 // does not have compile time constants, even though specializations of that
00038 // template do:
00039 //
00040 #if BOOST_RWSTD_VER < 0x020200
00041 #  define BOOST_NO_LIMITS_COMPILE_TIME_CONSTANTS
00042 #endif
00043 
00044 #if BOOST_RWSTD_VER <= 0x020101
00045 #  define BOOST_NO_LONG_LONG_NUMERIC_LIMITS
00046 # endif
00047 
00048 //
00049 // Borland version of numeric_limits lacks __int64 specialisation:
00050 //
00051 #ifdef __BORLANDC__
00052 #  define BOOST_NO_MS_INT64_NUMERIC_LIMITS
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 //
00056 // No std::iterator if it can't figure out default template args:
00057 //
00058 #if defined(_RWSTD_NO_SIMPLE_DEFAULT_TEMPLATES) || defined(RWSTD_NO_SIMPLE_DEFAULT_TEMPLATES) || (BOOST_RWSTD_VER < 0x020000)
00059 #  define BOOST_NO_STD_ITERATOR
00060 #endif
00061 
00062 //
00063 // No iterator traits without partial specialization:
00064 //
00065 #if defined(_RWSTD_NO_CLASS_PARTIAL_SPEC) || defined(RWSTD_NO_CLASS_PARTIAL_SPEC)
00066 #  define BOOST_NO_STD_ITERATOR_TRAITS
00067 #endif
00068 
00069 //
00070 // Prior to version 2.0, std::auto_ptr was buggy, and there were no
00071 // new-style iostreams, and no conformant std::allocator:
00072 //
00073 #if (BOOST_RWSTD_VER < 0x020000)
00074 #  define BOOST_NO_AUTO_PTR
00075 #  define BOOST_NO_STRINGSTREAM
00076 #  define BOOST_NO_STD_ALLOCATOR
00077 #  define BOOST_NO_STD_LOCALE
00078 #endif
00079 
00080 //
00081 // No template iterator constructors without member template support:
00082 //
00083 #if defined(RWSTD_NO_MEMBER_TEMPLATES) || defined(_RWSTD_NO_MEMBER_TEMPLATES)
00084 #  define BOOST_NO_TEMPLATED_ITERATOR_CONSTRUCTORS
00085 #endif
00086 
00087 //
00088 // RW defines _RWSTD_ALLOCATOR if the allocator is conformant and in use
00089 // (the or _HPACC_ part is a hack - the library seems to define _RWSTD_ALLOCATOR
00090 // on HP aCC systems even though the allocator is in fact broken):
00091 //
00092 #if !defined(_RWSTD_ALLOCATOR) || (defined(__HP_aCC) && __HP_aCC <= 33100)
00093 #  define BOOST_NO_STD_ALLOCATOR
00094 #endif
00095 
00096 //
00097 // If we have a std::locale, we still may not have std::use_facet:
00098 //
00099 #if defined(_RWSTD_NO_TEMPLATE_ON_RETURN_TYPE) && !defined(BOOST_NO_STD_LOCALE)
00100 #  define BOOST_NO_STD_USE_FACET
00101 #  define BOOST_HAS_TWO_ARG_USE_FACET
00102 #endif
00103 
00104 //
00105 // There's no std::distance prior to version 2, or without
00106 // partial specialization support:
00107 //
00108 #if (BOOST_RWSTD_VER < 0x020000) || defined(_RWSTD_NO_CLASS_PARTIAL_SPEC)
00109     #define BOOST_NO_STD_DISTANCE
00110 #endif
00111 
00112 //
00113 // Some versions of the rogue wave library don't have assignable
00114 // OutputIterators:
00115 //
00116 #if BOOST_RWSTD_VER < 0x020100
00117 #  define BOOST_NO_STD_OUTPUT_ITERATOR_ASSIGN
00118 #endif
00119 
00120
